messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: On October 18, DET. M. N. Collins was dispatched to Grand Park following reports of vandalism. Key informants were Mr. Mitchell, a groundskeeper, and Ms. Roberts, a morning jogger. FORWARD COPY TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION. INFORMANT DOCS. Lt. O. L. Foster - OPERATIONS Det. Collins, Jr. .. INVESTIGATIONS. Detective P. Q. Smith and Detective R. S. Turner provided additional support. VINSON 15:40 Vandalism Mr. Mitchell discovered damaged park benches and spray-painted statues, while Ms. Roberts mentioned seeing a group of teenagers late the previous night. Spray. Technician Jack retrieved paint cans left behind. CONTINUED FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Collins Jr, Det. Smith, Det. Turner OPERATIONS Lt. Foster INFORMANT Roberts, Linda 71 Birch Lane, Grand City, Wisconsin 150-555. 92510. VINSON 15:40 Vandalism At 2:20 PM, Detectives Collins, Smith, and Turner, with Lieutenant Foster, gathered additional evidence. Captain T. U. Howard advised checking local hardware stores for recent paint purchases. Sergeant V. W. Price and Sergeant X. Y. Lopez worked on identifying the teenagers. By 4:00 PM, two individuals were brought in for questioning. FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Collins Jr, Det. Smith, Det. Turner OPERATIONS Lt. Foster AFFIDAVIT - Vandalism Report 1) Left Behind Items 2) Witness Statements 3) F.I.R. 4) Photographs of Damage 5) Park Security Logs (6) Other Details LINE UP INFO ASSISTANT CHIEF DEPUTY IN CHARGE F. Johnson G.P.D. 15.99 P40 1772 Mitchell, GEORGE NAME: ADDRESS: TELEPHONE: 105-2074 DETECTIVE: M. COLLINS ITEM: 40-4700- 92 CRIME: 15:40 IDENTIFICATION NUMBER 82075 - CONFIRMED John Doe DATE 4/10/23 FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION CONTINUED.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: DET. M. N. Collins  Officer Context: On October 18, DET. M. N. Collins was dispatched to Grand Park following reports of vandalism. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Lt. O. L. Foster  Officer Context: Lt. O. L. Foster - OPERATIONS Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Detective P. Q. Smith  Officer Context: Detective P. Q. Smith and Detective R. S. Turner provided additional support. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective R. S. Turner  Officer Context: Detective P. Q. Smith and Detective R. S. Turner provided additional support. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Technician Jack  Officer Context: Spray. Technician Jack retrieved paint cans left behind. Officer Role: Technician Officer Name: Detective Collins  Officer Context: At 2:20 PM, Detectives Collins, Smith, and Turner, with Lieutenant Foster, gathered additional evidence. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Smith  Officer Context: At 2:20 PM, Detectives Collins, Smith, and Turner, with Lieutenant Foster, gathered additional evidence. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Turner  Officer Context: At 2:20 PM, Detectives Collins, Smith, and Turner, with Lieutenant Foster, gathered additional evidence. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Captain T. U. Howard  Officer Context: Captain T. U. Howard advised checking local hardware stores for recent paint purchases. Officer Role: Captain Officer Name: Sergeant V. W. Price  Officer Context: Sergeant V. W. Price and Sergeant X. Y. Lopez worked on identifying the teenagers. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sergeant X. Y. Lopez Officer Context: Sergeant V. W. Price and Sergeant X. Y. Lopez worked on identifying the teenagers. Officer Role: Sergeant
